page.title: 15HOOK NORTON -ECOLOGY
page.content: We went for a walk to the Nature Reserve. It used to be the old Hook Norton railway line. On the way we saw some "Jack in the hedge" and Dog roses. "Jack goes to bed at noon" is a plant that goes to bed at noon. It is bigger than a dandelion clock but looks like a dandelion clock. There was a very tall plant called Hog weed too. When we got there we went up some steps. When we got to the top we saw lots of plants and butterflies af all different colours. We could hear the birds singing and whistling.We went up the left bank and the right side bank. There was a big tunnel but it was blocked up. We could hear water dripping in the tunnel. There was a wall there that was for holding the clay back from the railway lnes. We also found lots of slag. On the way back we saw a Sparrow Hawk.
